TopicTitle: Some turmoil on steam discussions about a quote on quote "upcoming update" and what it could imply

Articles.Content:
On Steam, the top thread is that there is an update coming next week. If this is true, then the game could live on (barley)

https://steamcommunity.com/app/954850/discussions/0/4516632045446453190/?ctp=2

People believe it to be released tomorrow i guess
lol. this place is so well-adjusted compared to that discussion. thanks, mods.

2 hours ago, RUD Everyday said:

On Steam, the top thread is that there is an update coming next week. If this is true, then the game could live on (barley)

https://steamcommunity.com/app/954850/discussions/0/4516632045446453190/?ctp=2

People believe it to be released tomorrow i guess 

Response 1: Source?

500 responses later... no source....

There is no way people can realistically derive a date from the quoted text. They still refuse to admit closure of a studio touting more than a decade without a single employee.

Why would anyone expect accountability for a single project. I have to believe that the OP of the steam thread was being a troll. I cannot fathom an inability to parse legal speak from "update dropping 8/3/ 2024

He's just fishing for jester points is all.

move along

Steam forums are full of trolls, don't trust it too much. There were always these hand full of users provoking the readers throughout the entire development time with just 1-3 empty sentences, trying to get points. Palworld forums is similar ("game dead", "Pokemon rip off, you get sued"), only difference the game generally received way more positive reviews.

Might also be interesting, but don't bother looking for something clear:
If you get an update, it's guaranteed to be inconsequential. You don't take a game like this from 35% complete to any more than 35.0002% complete with zero staff working on it.

On 8/4/2024 at 6:55 PM, TLTay said:

If you get an update, it's guaranteed to be inconsequential. You don't take a game like this from 35% complete to any more than 35.0002% complete with zero staff working on it.

You have lofty estimations for the level of progress a new update would bring.
